name: Sonic Youth, Seattle, 1991
description: Sonic Youth opened for Neil Young at the Seattle Coliseum in the spring of 1991. A bigger stage for them at the time, for sure, or at least most of us have experienced to that point. Suddenly, right before their last song, Thurston troops over to where I’m standing in the ‘moat,’ grabs me by the arm and hoists me six feet up on to the stage like I’m a rag doll, dragging my knees against the side and bruising them. He announces, “Tonight we have our own personal photographer from The Star!” and then stepped back and posed. It took a couple of shots for Kim and Lee to catch on, this being shot number two. Of course me being a photographer I wanted to make it into a photo shoot, but they were on the clock, and five quick shots later Thurston ushered me off, laughing and waving no more at my repeated snapping.
